title: Awesome Video
header:
# Awesome Video [![Awesome](https://cdn.rawgit.com/sindresorhus/awesome/d7305f38d29fed78fa85652e3a63e154dd8e8829/media/badge.svg)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/awesome)
 
<!-- 

PLEASE DO NOT UPDATE THIS FILE, UPDATE CONTENTS.JSON INSTEAD. THANK YOU :-)

 -->
header_contributing: Please take a quick look at the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/krzemienski/awesome-video/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md) first. If you see a package or project here that is no longer maintained or is not a good fit, please submit a pull request to improve this file. Thank you to all [contributors](https://github.com/krzemienski/awesome-video/graphs/contributors); you rock!!

projects.description: At the recent World Wide Developer's Conference (WWDC), Apple announced that the next versions of Safari, iOS, and tvOS will support HLS with HEVC encoded video. This puts Apple firmly in the HEVC camp, with the Alliance for Open Media camp (Amazon, Cisco, Intel, Google, Microsoft, Mozilla, Netflix,
projects.title: The Market Significance of Apple's Adopting HEVC: Here's What I Think

projects.description: HEVC's main advantage over H.264 is that it offers roughly double the compression ratio for the same quality. This means that a video file encoded with HEVC can occupy half the space of its H.264 equivalent with no noticeable change in quality, or the same amount of space with improved quality.
projects.title: Guide to HEVC/H.265 Encoding and Playback
